title: Program
text:
Call for papers
All applicants must submit an abstract to be considered for attendance at the workshop.
Please use this abstract template.

Abstracts are submitted during registration.
Abstracts have a 500-word limit and should be submitted as a Word or PDF attachment during registration by February 1, 2026.
Submissions will be reviewed by the Program Committee and applicants will be notified of acceptance to the workshop by February 15, 2026 using the e-mail address provided in the submission form.

If a submitted abstract is accepted, one of the following will apply, depending on the results of the review:

Accepted for oral presentation at the workshop within a 20 minute time slot with extra 10 min for discussion.
Accepted for live demonstration at the workshop within a 15 minute time slot with extra 5 min for discussion.
Accepted for poster presentation (authors will present and discuss topics in one special poster session)



Workshop topics
Main conference topics are (but not limited to):

Relief representation
UAV and LiDAR data for terrain mapping
Artificial Intelligence in mountain cartography
Mapping for outdoor activities in mountains
Mapping and GIS of mountainous areas
Physical and topographic mapping
Mountain and glacier dynamics
Interactive atlases and new media applications
Other



Presentation formats
The following presentation formats are welcomed:

Oral presentation
Live demonstration
Poster presentation

title: XIV Mountain Cartography Workshop
text:
Welcome
The ICA Commission on Mountain Cartography is pleased to announce the 14th Mountain Cartography Workshop!
The workshop will be held at Harrachov, Czech Republic, a wonderful town nestled in the Krkonoše Mountains, renowned for its stunning mountain scenery, top-tier ski jumps, centuries-old glass factory, and rich brewing heritage!
The main theme of the workshop is “New directions of the mountain cartography”. As we live in a intensively evolving world, many new problems as well as technological possibilities arise in cartographic research and practice.
Submitted papers, presentations and panels can deal with any aspects of mountain cartography, or spatial data related to mountain environments. Different presentation types are kindly welcomed, from classic research papers to live software demonstrations and problem discussions.
See you in Harrachov!



Patrick Kennelly, Chair
Timofey Samsonov, Vice-Chair
ICA Mountain Cartography Commission

title: Travel
text:
If you are going from the airport, a the most convenient way is by bus.

By bus
You can use IDOS bus operator. We recommend buying tickets in advance
Way from the airport:

Praha Airport - bus line 100 to metro station Zličín
Use metro B, Zličín to the final stop Černý most. You need to buy a 90-minute metro ticket (the journey takes 40 minutes without transfers)
There is a bus station, here you can take the long-distance bus line 700 or 900



By train
You can use České dráhy railway operator.
Way from the airport:

Take the bus from the airport AE 1042 to Prague main station
Take the train to Harrachov.
You must change trains at least once, in Tanvald. The actual number of transfers varies depending on the individual times







Note



Train service to Harrachov is infrequent and generally slow, often requiring multiple transfers, so taking a bus is the recommended option.




By Bolt taxi
For an extremely convenient—but costly—option, you can take a Bolt directly from Prague Airport to Hotel Svornost.

Prices start at around 3,500 CZK per group of up to four travelers.
Request the ride through the Bolt app and always check that the car has enough space for your party, including luggage.



By car
Approximate travel duration to Harrachov by car:

from Prague airport ~2.5 hours (depending on rush hour, you take the D10)
from Dresden ~3 hours
from Wrocław ~2 hours

Hotel information
Workshop will be hosted by Svornost Hotel
Address: Harrachov 496, 512 46 HARRACHOV, Česká Republika

Room options
A room is reserved during registration (see below). There are three room options:

Single room, with full board: 10221 CZK
A bed in a double room, shared with another participant, with full board: 8097 CZK
A double room, for a participant accompanied by spouse / partner, with full board for both: 16194 CZK

The full board includes 4x buffeе breakfast, 3x buffet lunch and 3x buffer dinner. For the outdoor / field exploration day, the guest may opt to replace the buffet lunch with a sandwich package. The full board does not include dinner on day 4, when participants will be eating out. Each of the options include access to the hotel pool between 7 a.m. and 9 p.m.
Expenses not covered by the price: transportation, outdoor activities, traditional local dinner on day 4, optional outdoor parking (120 CZK / night), optional additional food and beverages not covered by the full board or requested during coffee breaks.
The prices are final, including 12% VAT on housing and 21% VAT on the registration fee.



Registration fee
The workshop registration fee is 1700 CZK per participant, which is in addition to Svornost Hotel room reservation price.

Upon completing the registration form, you will receive a personalized e-mail with a payment link covering both the hotel and the conference fee. You can pay by card, Apple Pay, or Wise; cash payment on site is also possible.
Online payments can be made in CZK, or—if you indicate this in the registration form—in EUR or USD. EUR and USD payments are converted to CZK at a favorable market rate. Only CZK cash payments are accepted if you choose to pay on site.







Note



All applicants must submit an abstract during registration. See the submission guidelines on the Program page.
